1.title: The Murder of Detective Mike Lane
1.plot: On December 13, 1979 there was a shootout on the streets of Whittier California. This shootout involved 3 undercover Whittier Police Detectives and two motorcycle gang members. In the end two lives were lost. One of which was Detective Michael Lane. Mike Lane was the second Officer in the department's history to have been killed in the line of duty. The first was Detective John Pierce, only 3 years earlier. The purpose of Forgotten Tales has always been to shine a light on forgotten history - but in this case, it's to ensure that the story of Detective Michael Lane is...

1.title: The Crash of Flight 416 West
1.plot: Flight 416 West left New York City on April 16, 1952, and crashed into the hills above Whittier, and Hacienda Heights California on April 18, 1952 killing all 29 passengers aboard. This are is also known as Turnbull Canyon.

2.title: Two Whittier Men and Their Wild Ride
2.plot: Norman Shaeff and Fred DuVall, two oil men from Whittier are chased down Turnbull Canyon by a beast on November 10, 1900. This is a true story.

1.title: Puente Sky Ranch Airport
1.plot: The City of La Puente once had an airport, the Puente Sky Ranch Airport.

2.title: The Electrodome
2.plot: In the 1930's, a man named William Haight took over an abandoned oil derrick at the summit of Turnbull Canyon in the Hacienda Heights / Whittier area. William built a laboratory at the top of the derrick. This laboratory housed a device that had the ability to manipulate the weather... Mr. Haight called this device, "The Electrodome."

3.title: Music in the Valley
3.plot: In the San Gabriel Valley during the 1950s and 60s were years of growth that laid the foundation for the current communities we know today. During this time the first neighborhoods, churches, schools and businesses were built. Along with the essentials for a growing community, there was also the need for entertainment. This story explores the valley's earliest dance halls, bars, clubs, honky tonks, the musical acts that entertained there, and the people who hung out there.

4.title: How the Canyon Got Its Name
4.plot: The name Turnbull Canyon conjures up visions of urban legends, and myths... But perhaps the biggest mystery the canyon holds is How the Canyon Got its name.

1.title: Gay's Lion Farm
1.plot: A long time ago, over 250 lions were kept in the City of El Monte where the 10 freeway meets the intersection of Peck and Valley Blvd. Several motion pictures were shot there and over 2 million people came to visit this one of a kind place. Today, the roar of the lions has been replaced by the roar of engines... but if you come with me we'll take a look back at the unbelievable Forgotten Tale of Gay's Lion Farm.

2.title: Nike Missile Bases
2.plot: During the Cold War, it was a very different time in this country. It was a time of national paranoia and fear. In the Los Angeles area, this county's military was looking to protect it, and the west coast. from Russian bomber strikes. Two of these bases were with-in the borders of the old Rancho La Puente... and we were thankful.

1.title: The Misplaced MIA
1.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

2.title: The Battle of Providencia: A Forgotten Tale of the Cahuenga Pass
2.plot: Burbank used to be known as the Rancho Providencia. but in late February of 1845 you would have seen cannons and muskets being fired across the Los Angeles River. Average men rose to the occasion to assist in the revolt that would unseat a tyrannical governor, and replace him with Pío de Jesus Pico, a first generation Californian, who to many, was the face of democracy. After this battle, Pío Pico would become the LAST Governor of Mexican California. But he was the FIRST to be elected. Not by ballot - But by war.

1.title: The First Picture Show
1.plot: Living in the San Gabriel Valley and Whittier area, we have had many walk-in movie theatres over the decades. Many of which are now gone, and few remain. The Star Theatre in La Puente has been a landmark for generations - But it's days may be numbered. Learn why this seemingly down and out theatre is actually a treasure hidden in plain sight, and also learn about the multiple theatres that existed in the surrounding areas. Dim the lights, fire up the projector and peer into the magic of our valley's first walk-in movie theatres.

2.title: Quake City '87: A Forgotten Tale of Whittier
2.plot: On October 1, 1987 at 7:42am, a 5.9 earthquake shook the small town of Whittier. Nerves were rattled, buildings collapsed, and families lost their homes. Today, Whittier has moved on, but the town still bares the scars from this defining moment in the city's history. This video contains first hand accounts of some of the people who lived through this horrible day.

imdb.title: Forgotten Tales
plot: _Forgotten Tales_ (qv) explores the history of Southern California that most don't know about, or has been long forgotten.::John Garside
